page.title: 08DUNSCOMBE FARM NEWTON ST.C.
page.content: The present tenants of Dunscombe are Mr. and Mrs P. Browne.Mr Browne farms {cattle for beef}and he also grows {swedes,potatoes,grass for grazing and {silage,and corn.}He grows three different kinds of swedes and potatoes for{human consumption.}One hundred acres of land is used for growing grass for silage and another hundred for grazing grass.Twenty-five acres of land are used for growing potatoes and another twenty-five for swedes.Thirty-five acres of the land is growing{winter barley}and a hundred and forty-five for{winter wheat.}This will go for making{animal food.}Mr Browne would keep{a steer for about {one and a half to two years then it {would go to an abbatoir in the {Midlands.} Mr Browne has six silos _ special places to store corn. {Each silo holds eighty tons of corn.
